articles.title: Sutter Health remains low on COVID-19 vaccine doses after reporting shortage - KCRA Sacramento
articles.description: Sutter Health said it was allocated around 30,000 vaccine doses that will arrive next week, with another 30,000 the week of March 15. Despite the latest allocation, the status of second-dose appointments for an additional 30,000 patients remains unclear.
articles.content: SACRAMENTO, Calif. —After reporting a shortage of supply that placed about 90,000 second COVID-19 vaccine doses in jeopardy of being rescheduled, Sutter Health announced it will be able to keep some … [+1363 chars]
